Core molecular function with direct experimental evidence.
p53 binds to consensus sequences in target gene promoters.
Well-documented function of p53 as a transcriptional
repressor, complementing its role as an activator. This is
essential for its tumor suppressor function.
p53 regulates mitophagy through multiple mechanisms
genes. This is part of its broader role in cellular stress
While p53 has developmental roles, these are not its
primary functions. p53-null mice can complete embryonic
development, though with increased cancer susceptibility.
Very specific developmental process that is not central to
p53 function. p53 knockout mice complete somitogenesis

Fundamental molecular function of p53. Encompasses both

Ambiguous annotation - p53 undergoes nuclear import but
does not regulate protein import into nucleus as a general
function. This appears to be a misannotation.
Fundamental function with strong experimental support. p53
is the guardian of the genome.

Not a core p53 function. May relate to indirect effects

Core component of p53-mediated intrinsic apoptosis. p53

Important function - p53 restricts stem cell self-renewal
to maintain genomic integrity and prevent transformation.
